definition: to play music/to achieve/to present a memorial to the emperor (old)

sentences.english: We filed out to the accompaniment of the organ.
sentences.chinese: 我們在管風琴伴奏下魚貫而出。

sentences.english: " The Fantasticks" has only 8 actors. There are only 2 musicians.
sentences.chinese: “異想天開”只有8個演員和2名伴奏人員。

sentences.english: The way you mentioned is just to provide ACC.
sentences.chinese: 提供伴奏的時候，可以用你的方法。

sentences.english: When Qu flute accompanies with Kun opera, it fully embodies the advantages of itself.
sentences.chinese: 曲笛爲崑曲伴奏的時候，充分體現了自身的優勢。

sentences.english: He accompanied her singing on a lute-like instrument.
sentences.chinese: 他彈一件類似琵琶的樂器爲她伴奏。

sentences.english: Was it because of the Quranic verses read in melodic background?
sentences.chinese: 難道是因爲朗誦可蘭經詩篇時有音樂伴奏嗎？

sentences.english: The pianist improvised an accompaniment to the song.
sentences.chinese: 那位鋼琴家爲那首歌即席伴奏。

sentences.english: Mr. Hillme, her social-studies teacher and accompanist, winked at her.
sentences.chinese: 希爾米先生是她的社會課老師兼伴奏，向她眨眼示意。

sentences.english: The singer was accompanied by her sister at the piano.
sentences.chinese: 這位歌唱家由她妹妹擔任鋼琴伴奏。

sentences.english: Slow-dance at a restaurant -- when there's no music playing.
sentences.chinese: 在餐館中，沒有音樂伴奏下，和你的戀人跳慢舞。

sentences.english: I remember at college, there were many acappella singing groups.
sentences.chinese: 就像幾個人的合唱組合一樣，沒有伴奏的。

sentences.english: The poetry was chanted to the accompaniment of the lyre.
sentences.chinese: 詩歌吟唱時是用七絃琴伴奏的。

sentences.english: The well known singer was accompanied at the piano by Mr. Moore.
sentences.chinese: 那位著名的歌唱家由穆爾先生鋼琴伴奏。

sentences.english: Joining Jennifer and Karen on the CD are Andrea Niemiec on the string double bass and Terry Ostergaard on the bodhran.
sentences.chinese: 雙低音伴奏是安德烈尼米克，鼓手是特里厄斯特高。

sentences.english: These are popular accompaniments to breakfast or brunch fare.
sentences.chinese: 這些都是受歡迎的伴奏，以早餐或午餐車費。

definition: vocal accompaniment/to accompany a singer/to support of sb/to echo sb/to chime in with sb
to perform on a musical instrument
to sing opera music (without staging or make up)
to sing and play (plucked string instrument)
